sections.title: Modern Portfolio Theory Basics
sections.content: Modern Portfolio Theory (MPT) shows that combining assets with low correlation can reduce overall portfolio risk while maintaining expected returns. The efficient frontier represents the optimal risk-return combinations. Diversification works best when assets don't move in perfect syncâ€”aim for correlations below 0.7 for meaningful risk reduction.

points.title: Asset Class Diversification
points.description: Spread investments across stocks, bonds, real estate, commodities, and alternatives to capture different return drivers.

points.title: Geographic Diversification
points.description: Invest internationally to benefit from global growth and reduce country-specific risks like political instability or currency fluctuations.

points.title: Sector and Industry Diversification
points.description: Avoid over-concentration in single sectors; use equal-weight or cap-weighted approaches to maintain balance.

sections.title: Correlation Matters More Than Number of Holdings
sections.content: Owning 50 highly correlated stocks isn't diversified. Focus on low-correlation assets like combining U.S. stocks with international bonds or adding alternatives like gold or real estate.

sections.title: Rebalancing Strategies
sections.content: Rebalancing involves selling winners and buying losers to return to target allocations. Calendar rebalancing (quarterly/annually) is simple but may miss opportunities. Threshold rebalancing (when allocations drift 5-10% from targets) is more efficient but requires monitoring. Set rules and automate where possible to avoid emotional decisions.

sections.title: Apply Diversification This Month
steps: Calculate current portfolio correlations using free online tools or brokerage reports
Identify over-concentrations (e.g., >20% in one stock/sector) and plan reductions
Add one new asset class (e.g., international bonds) to improve diversification
Set up automatic rebalancing alerts in your brokerage account

sections.title: Diversification Isn't Risk Elimination
sections.content: It reduces unsystematic risk but can't eliminate market risk. Combine with appropriate asset allocation based on your risk tolerance and time horizon.
